snippet: A census of the city’s demise shows how many buildings must be torn down, but that would be just the starting point for a real rescue effort.
abstract: Editorial heralds new report on blight in Detroit, saying it is a starting point for fresh conversation on how to revive the city and others like it across country; agrees with several of its recommendations, including prioritizing blight removal and reforming city's property taxes; holds any comprehensive plan will need the help of the state and federal government.
lead_paragraph: A census of the city’s demise shows how many buildings must be torn down, but that would be just the starting point for a real rescue effort.
